newsitem.title: USA: Duramed sees $5 - $6 mln Q3 loss.
newsitem.headline: Duramed sees $5 - $6 mln Q3 loss.

text.p: Duramed Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Wednesday it expected to report a loss of between $5 million and $6 million in the third quarter, before one-time charges related to its Hallmark Pharmaceuticals acquisition.

Duramed said the estimate included the impact of price erosion, $3.4 million in product development expense, a $500,000 reserve for possible uncollected funds owed by a large wholesale customer, and about $600,000 in continuing expenses.
The First Call mean earnings estimate for fiscal 1996 was $0.01 per share. There was no estimate for the third quarter.

The company also said it believed the U.S. Food and Drug Administration review process for approval of its 0.625 milligram dosage of conjugated estrogens had been prolonged by a challenge from an innovator company.
Management said it expected the product would be approved by end 1996 and that the challenge was without merit.
Conjugated estrogens are used to relieve symptoms of menopause and osteoporosis, a Duramed spokeswoman said.

"Based on information recently made known to the company, we believe there is new momentum and a new commitment to closure on this important issue by the FDA," Thomas Arington, chairman and chief executive officer, said.
Duramed also said it was continuing its aggressive product development program.
